children.tweet: @jdmcleodjr Fair enough. My students are K, 5, & 6, & I couldn't be happier w/Common Core thus far. I feel like it teaches "why" math works.
@jdmcleodjr Something that frustrated me all through school - I knew facts, didn't get the why behind facts. Rote memorization. :(
@jdmcleodjr Only one of my kids who struggled a bit was 6th grader, but she'd adjusted by 2nd quarter.
@jdmcleodjr I have friends w/kids at other schools who hate CommonCore. Being taught differently? By teachers who don't get it, either? IDK
@jdmcleodjr Aha! Now I get you. That's why I asked how it's being taught. My kids' teachers use varied methods to teach CC requirements.
@jdmcleodjr Srsly? I know my K has done a lot, but that's typical for K. More worksheets isn't teaching. D:<
@jdmcleodjr I know you said you don't want to be "that" parent, but worksheets are for reinforcement, not teaching. Teacher cop out!
@jdmcleodjr No wonder he says he hates school.
@Korrinie mine has done, no kidding 500 worksheets this year.
@jdmcleodjr If students don't get it, they will use another method & explain CC through back door, so to speak.
@Korrinie i guess more than anything I'm not wild about the the underlying idea that everyone falls into the same system.
@jdmcleodjr Not invalidating your experience. Common Core seems to be extremely polarizing. Either it immediately clicks or it's a struggle.
@Korrinie I'm not sure how to distinguish the two.
@jdmcleodjr Are you upset w/Common Core, or the way it's being implemented @ the school?
@kirkjeffery give me a minute. I'm still processing my thoughts.
@kirkjeffery my son is learning about the war of 1812 in 2nd grade. How in the world can he begin to process that?
@jdmcleodjr 8th grade social studies has always been about national indoctrination, so no real difference there.
@kirkjeffery mostly I'm concerned about the mathematical system they are using and the manner in which they are teaching war.
@jdmcleodjr Ok.
@kirkjeffery and he has learned to count on his fingers. That's how they are teaching him. He has regressed substantially this year.
@kirkjeffery and I'm fine with that. But to me. Outcome is more important than methodology and when you have a kid who gets it, why tell
@kirkjeffery yes! I don't want to be that guy. I told L that this morning.
@jdmcleodjr Yeah. I'm also frustrated, so much so that I won't talk to the teachers because I come off as the asshole parent.
@jdmcleodjr After my daughter completed and won her science project, we found out that she needed to have it approved by an IRB.
@jdmcleodjr pretty much. She setup a perceived sweetness experiment between 2 artificial sweeteners and regular cane sugar.
@kirkjeffery "I acknowledge that I am sipping lemonade of my own accord and can stop anytime I want?"
@jdmcleodjr Yeah. She couldn't go to state because we didn't have informed consent by the participants.
@kirkjeffery seriously?
@jdmcleodjr I came off the rails. A fucking IRB for sips of lemon aid.
@jdmcleodjr Oh, and of course, the school district didn't have an IRB setup to run it through.
@kirkjeffery no. It is. I just needed to vent on some of the issues that we are running into.
@jdmcleodjr I know it's no consolation, but my preschooler hates school this year too. I think her teacher is in the wrong grade level.
@kirkjeffery him he is wrong.
@jdmcleodjr So what they are teaching is how to do things in a way that is easier for our minds to comprehend.
@jdmcleodjr I also think blaming a curriculum is a bad choice to place blame. Blame a poorly equipped teacher, blame a political system,
@jdmcleodjr @kirkjeffery the way we encouraged curiosity  and their innate abilities made it frustrating for them.
@jazzpastord @jdmcleodjr The best teachers will teach according to student ability and learning style regardless of the curriculum.
@jazzpastord @jdmcleodjr There are always more than one way to get to the answer. One math class Jamie took in college, each student...
@kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr :)
@jazzpastord @jdmcleodjr Yes. But what do you think that taught a certain future math teacher?
@kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr yeah. College.  Not public high school in the rural Midwest.
@jazzpastord @jdmcleodjr had to solve the pythagorean theorem by a different proof.
@jdmcleodjr @kirkjeffery similarly when my dad helped me w/ geometry, I'd get the right answer but fail the proof cuz I had different steps
@jazzpastord @kirkjeffery and that may just be where we are at as well. I just don't want him to lose his love of learning.
@jdmcleodjr @kirkjeffery both of mine would say that and neither was in common core. They hated the rigidity, the mundane repetitious work.
@jdmcleodjr @kirkjeffery I also might look deeper.  Is it possible there's bullying? Or being excluded. Or...? #reasonstohateschool
@jdmcleodjr @kirkjeffery those 2 things alone put him on center stage at an age you only want that if it's something extremely cool
@jazzpastord it really is cool.  It both sucks and we are looking for solutions.
@jdmcleodjr As your friend, I simply should have said: that sucks! I'm sorry you guys are having a rough go. #bettybuttinski
@jazzpastord @kirkjeffery no. It's cool. We talk about those things and right now he is the kid with the wheelchair and walker so...
@jdmcleodjr @kirkjeffery sorry to butt in.  #bettybuttinski
@kirkjeffery I can hear that. But at least in part, mandatory curriculum creates disgruntled teachers and that creates dysfunctional systems
@kirkjeffery you and Jamie know much more of the systemic stuff. I'm just reflecting on the experience of a parent struggling to keep the
@jdmcleodjr Yeah. My 10yr old exceptionally gifted struggles too. School is hard.
@jdmcleodjr @kirkjeffery that has been incredibly hard for both our kids. I think it's because we are openly and naturally learning at home.
@kirkjeffery light of learning lit in my kid.
@jdmcleodjr @kirkjeffery Ouch.  O.o
@kirkjeffery believe me. I take no pleasure in finding myself on the same side of an issue as Glenn Beck.
@jdmcleodjr But to blame a curriculum, well, that seems...
@kirkjeffery I do. But I never remember coming home and saying "I hate school." The taller one does this weekly.
@jdmcleodjr Wait for it. Remember your first year of seminary, which tore down all you thought you knew from Sunday School.
@kirkjeffery last year at home he was starting to learn times tables. This year he can't tell you what 14-7 is without a 5 step equation.
@jdmcleodjr As far as math, well, the method makes a lot more sense in practical, day to day living.
@jdmcleodjr I am always amused (because I can't do it) that Jamie can hand a cashier a hand full of coins, the cashier will look at it,
@jdmcleodjr Jamie will look exasperated, and say, "put it in the machine." They will, and she'll get a quarter in change.
@theleannem @kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr as a parent who moved kids a lot, I wish common core had been in place nationally.
@kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr I believe that common core is another form of it. And, yes, it is based off high stakes testing, and feeds into it,
@theleannem @jdmcleodjr They aren't already with the standards that have been in place for a generation. That is an invalid argument.
@kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr yup. common core feeds into the standardized testing, though. Doesn't allow teacher to go off script.
@theleannem @jdmcleodjr Every single teacher I know hates standardized testing. Every. One. They know who gets it and who doesn't.
@theleannem @kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr I think you make a strong point.
@ggbolt16 @kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr I would argue that this is often because we dont trust teachers. My son can't have a C! He deserves an A!
@theleannem @kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr I agree with trusting teachers but I've seen top in valedictorians not prepared for college
@ggbolt16 @kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr they are professionals. Let them act like it. And treat them like it.
@ggbolt16 @kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr don't focus on the big scale...trust your local teachers to determine how best to serve the kids,
@ggbolt16 @theleannem @kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr that's not to say there aren't legitimate concerns and need for IEPs
@theleannem @kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr  Just like we default to common core some default to iep to assuage parents
@theleannem @kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr is that coupled with more competitive higher cost college and a collapsed economy.
@theleannem @kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr I believe we have similar biases
@ggbolt16 @kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr And also (my bias is showing) a political/social agenda.
@theleannem @kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr I think you're right and those decisions were based on decreased funding to afforded exp teachers
@ggbolt16 @kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr ...to push the idea of quantifiable data points of "success."
@ggbolt16 @kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr When you have people who only have three weeks of teacher training, it's easy to not trust them and...
@ggbolt16 @kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr And the pushing out of experienced, trained teachers in favor of trainees from programs like TfA.
@theleannem @kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr the margins are smaller. Having to do more (testing) with less (teachers)
@ggbolt16 @kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr IMHO, It's gotten worse.
@kirkjeffery @theleannem @jdmcleodjr yes but what IS the solution. Many were failed before those standardizations
@ggbolt16 @theleannem @jdmcleodjr Standardized, high stakes test in has not fixed our schools, who, regrettably fail many.
@theleannem @kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr it's not an easy fix
@ggbolt16 @kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr precisely. But the "national standards" and "benchmarks" focus on verifiable data: regurgitated facts.
@theleannem @kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr Ideally I'd like to see more focus on HOW to learn rather than a list of facts. Although facts are good
@ggbolt16 @kirkjeffery @jdmcleodjr ieps are reserved for those who qualify for special education services.
@kirkjeffery @theleannem @jdmcleodjr I'm not a fan of common core but also don't think a million IEPs are the way to go either.
@ggbolt16 @theleannem @jdmcleodjr You have to trust the teachers.
@kirkjeffery @theleannem @jdmcleodjr how do you help individuals achieve needed ed goals on the scale of public schools in USA without it
@theleannem @jdmcleodjr they know which students they are effective with and which ones they aren't. They know which kids connect and don't.
@theleannem @jdmcleodjr They all know which kids have problems at home which impacts their learning. Standardized, high stakes testing is BS
@jdmcleodjr @kirkjeffery I dislike the idea that children are like products on a line...that they can be product tested by a single standard
@kirkjeffery also the cog in the wheel mentality that undergirds it.
@jdmcleodjr Care to expand?
